item.title: "Hello World!" Linux Kernel Module
item.description: What is a kernel module? Kernel modules are the pieces of code that can be loaded and unloaded into the kernel upon demand. They extend the functionality of the kernel without the need to reboot the system. The device drivers, networking stack; for almost everything you will find a module in the kernel.

item.title: Compile Linux Kernel (on Fedora), Pune Kernel Meetup Assignment
item.description: Pune Kernel Meetup Assignment. An assignment was given at Pune Kernel Meetup-January-2018, for people to get started with linux kernel. The assignment was to print “Hello World” as the first line in the kernel boot up. So here is the solution to this problem that I could find. The Solution.

item.title: February 2016 frdora meetup pune
item.description: On 6-Feb-2016 it was third Fedora meetup at pune at the same venue as earlier meetups “K 104, Jasminium, Magarpatta City Pune”. Event host was Kushal Das. For this meetup the ajenda was “Debugging bugs in different applications written in C/Python in Fedora”. But after last meetup Amol and me had discussed about writing a tool like “Ip messenger” (our purpose was for file transfer) for linux which will be a nautilus plugin; so we decided that in this meetup we will do it.
